There are several options based on the specifics of what you want to 
collect.

If you just want single seeds and their inline resources, you can start 
with the defalt configuration and set the 'max-hops' value of the 
'rejectIfTooManyHops'/TooManyHopsDecideRule to zero (0). (This rules out 
everything but the seeds themselves at that scope step, but then the 
later TransclusionDecideRule will bring back in those that were 
discovered via short embed/inline references.)

If you want to follow links out one hop, you can set this value to '1'. 
But, starting with the default configuration, other rules will still be 
applying a limiting scope implied by the seeds. So if you have a seed:

http://domain.tld/whatever/page.html

...but not...

http://domain.tld/

...then only URIs starting "http://domain.tld/whatever/" (as deduced 
from the seed, and represented by the SURT-form 
"http://(tld,domain,)/whatever/") will pass the earlier scope-rule, and 
thus be eligible for the 1-link-away testing.

If you want to follow links out one hop to any site, then replace the 
first rule with an AcceptDecideRule. This makes the crawl 
default-accept, rather than default-reject, leaving it up to later rules 
to stop certain paths. If your 'max-hops' is 1, that rule will rule-out 
everything more than one hop away. (And again, some extra things will be 
transcluded.)

Of course, 'max-hops' can also be any other value.

- Gordon
